{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient sustained an ankle injury and was immobilized for 3 months. Later, he complained of pain and swelling in the left calf, left ankle, and foot. His mother massaged him for 30 minutes. After a while, he developed acute onset of breathlessness and died. Given the history of immobilization, pain, swelling, and sudden onset of breathlessness, the most likely cause of death is pulmonary thromboembolism. Immobilization can lead to deep vein thrombosis (DVT), and if a clot dislodges and travels to the lungs, it can cause a pulmonary embolism, which can be fatal.", "answer_choice": "A"}
